title: AI Specialist
description:
Are you a Data Scientist with an advanced degree in Data Science or a related field? Are you passionate about the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and eager to lead the implementation of large language models (LLMs) for interactive AI applications? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to take the reins of a groundbreaking project at Medpace.
   

  

 We are currently seeking a professional with direct experience implementing large language models (LLMs) with interactive artificial intelligence (AI). Skills and training in natural language processing (NLP) and deep learning will be critical for this role. This professional will be expected to lead the fine-tuning of a privately-hosted LLM. This professional will work collaboratively with business teams, information technology (IT), and data science teams to design the roadmap for how an LLM can improve efficiency of company processes. Applicants should have sufficient technical skills to lead this project independently and to train technical teams for support.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Implement a private, large language model, fine-tuned based on both structured and text-based data inputs
* Integrate artificial intelligence to support a chatbot feature to interact with the LLM
* Contribute to data architecture review, and support structural changes as needed
* Support departmental process improvement initiatives; and
* Participate in training and development of more junior team members


**Qualifications**
* Masters or PhD in engineering, computer or data science, or related field.
* Proven experience implementing and fine-tuning Large Language Models for interactive AI applications (either >1 year post-graduate experience, or PhD dissertation experience)
* Strong background in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and deep learning.
* Technical proficiency in programming languages and frameworks commonly used in NLP and AI (e.g., Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Demonstrated ability to lead projects independently and mentor technical teams.
* A passion for staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in NLP and AI technologies.
* Analytical thinker with great attention to detail.


**Medpace Overview**
 Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 5,000 people across 40+ countries.
   

  

**Why Medpace?**
 People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Join Us Today.
   

  

 The work we’ve done over the past 30+ years has positively impacted the lives of countless patients and families who face hundreds of diseases across all key therapeutic areas. The work we do today will improve the lives of people living with illness and disease in the future.
   

  

**Cincinnati Perks**
* Cincinnati Campus Overview
* Hybrid work-from-home options (dependent upon position and level)
* Competitive PTO packages, starting at 20+ days
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Flexible work schedule
* Company-sponsored employee appreciation events
* Employee health and wellness initiatives
* Community involvement with local nonprofit organizations
* Discounts on local sports games, fitness gyms and attractions
* Modern, ecofriendly campus with an on-site fitness center
* Structured career paths with opportunities for professional growth
* Discounted tuition for UC online programs


**Awards**
* Named a Top Workplace in 2024 by The Cincinnati Enquirer
* Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Most Successful Midsize Companies in 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024
* Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility


**What To Expect Next**
 A Medpace team member will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted with details for next steps.

title: Research Scientist 4 - VID 164727
company: New York State Office of Cannabis Management
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**
 A bachelor’s degree and five years of professional research experience in a filed relevant to professional cannabis testing/research including environmental, pharmacy, public health, or natural sciences.
   

  

 OR
   

  

 A master’s degree in the field of Environmental Science or Natural Sciences and four years of professional environmental research experience in a field relevant to professional cannabis testing/researching including environmental, pharmacy, public health, or natural sciences.
   

  

 OR
   

  

 A doctoral degree in the field of Environmental Science or Natural Sciences and four years of professional environmental research experience in a field relevant to professional cannabis testing/researching including environmental, pharmacy, public health, or natural sciences.
   

  

**Duties Description**
 Reporting to the Deputy Director of Health & Safety, this position will be responsible for providing clinical support and guidance to the Office of Cannabis Management (OCM) and key stakeholders. The Research Scientist 4 is expected to be an expert in cannabis pharmacology, drug therapies, and adverse reactions who stays updated on scientific literature and research. The Research Scientist 4 will be responsible for offering guidance and making recommendations for cannabis policies and rules that impacts the health of cannabis consumers and medical cannabis patients. The Research Scientist 4 will also provide outreach and education to the clinical community about cannabis. The Research Scientist 4 will actively engage with the medical cannabis community, offering presentations, developing resources, and communicating directly with key stakeholders. They will serve as the main point of contact for addressing questions and requests for information that is clinical in nature.
   

  

**Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Conduct and oversee assigned OCM led scientific research studies.
* Lead the development and design of research study protocols, documents, analytic tools, and other related resources.
* Develop cannabis health and safety surveys and assist with the analysis of data.
* Provide education and training on medical cannabis, cannabis science, and the medical cannabis program to external stakeholders using relevant peer reviewed, evidence-based data.
* Assist with the review of scientific data, methods, or applications submitted to OCM.
* Serve as a cannabis science subject matter expert (SME) in the development of OCM educational content and materials.
* Assist with inquiries of a clinical nature regarding cannabis, cannabis products, or clinical matters impacting the various programs of the Office.
* Remain abreast of federal cannabis activity, scientific literature, clinical trials, and current events and provide program and policy recommendations to senior leadership.
* Draft regulatory documents, memos, research study reports, peer-reviewed scientific publications, manuscripts, posters, or other documents intended for external audiences.
* Present research findings at conferences and meetings.
* Facilitate and participate in meetings with external stakeholders.
* Other projects as assigned to support the Health and Safety Unit.
* Perform full range of supervisory functions.


**Note**
**Additional Comments**
* Travel may be required (approximately 10%), including during evening and weekends, depending on mission and assignment.
* Possession and maintenance of a valid Driver’s License issued by the NYS Department of Motor Vehicle is required, or otherwise demonstrate the capacity to meet the transportation needs of the job.


 The Office of Cannabis Management (OCM) is an equal opportunity employer, and we recognize that diversity in our workforce is critical to fulfilling our mission. We encourage applicants for all communities to apply. For a full version of OCM’s EEO/AA statement and benefits of joining OCM, please visit: About | Office of Cannabis Management (ny.gov).
   

  

 NOTE ON TELECOMMUTING: Employees are required to apply and obtain approval through management to telecommute according to the agency’s Telecommuting Program Guidelines.
   

  

 Downstate: Location Pay of $3,400

title: Staff Scientist - Data Science/Machine Learning
description:
**Summary**
 The Office of Surgical Research (OSR) within the Michael E. DeBakey Department of Surgery is seeking a Staff Scientist to develop advanced analytic tools (data mining, machine learning, and artificial intelligence) for research projects using surgical data. The Staff Scientist will collaborate with research faculty and other research personnel to design and conduct research experiments using machine learning algorithms and creating predictive models. The ideal candidate must demonstrate a robust background in data science and machine learning, encompassing the application of statistical methods, the creation of predictive models, and the development of machine learning algorithms. Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and R, combined with experience in signal and image analysis, as well as familiarity with electronic health data, will be distinct advantages.
   

  

**Job Duties**
* Plan, direct, and conduct research projects related to surgical data.
* Collect, clean, and preprocess structured and unstructured data from various sources to build high-quality datasets for analysis.
* Analyze large amounts of data to find patterns and solutions.
* Develop prediction systems and machine learning algorithms to select features, create and optimize classifiers.
* Design and conduct experiments to validate findings.
* Prototype, troubleshoot, and fine-tune machine learning models for outcome predictions relevant to surgery.
* Evaluate machine learning training using tools such as precision-recall metrics, receiver-operator curves, and confusion matrices.
* Present data to investigators.
* Author scientific manuscripts.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Doctoral Degree. Experience may not be substituted in lieu of degree.
* Three years of post doctoral research experience.


 Department Specific Criteria
   

  

* Background in data science and machine learning, encompassing the application of statistical methods, the creation of predictive models, and the development of machine learning algorithms.
* Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, and R, combined with experience in image analysis.
* Familiarity with electronic health data.


 Baylor College of Medicine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Equal Access Employer.

title: Optimization engineer
description:
**Optimization engineer**




  





 My client is at the forefront of financial innovation, leveraging cutting-edge technology for automated trading systems within the HFT space. The team is passionate about developing sophisticated algorithms and strategies that drive high performance in the dynamic world of financial markets. I am seeking a highly skilled individual with strong analytical, statistical, and quantitative skills to join an elite team.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




  





 As an optimization engineer, you will play a pivotal role in the optimization of automated trading systems. Your primary focus will be on enhancing system performance, improving execution strategies, and developing robust automation solutions. You will collaborate closely with traders, quantitative analysts, and software engineers to design, implement, and refine trading algorithms.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Develop and maintain Python-based automation tools for trading systems.
* Optimize trading algorithms to improve performance and efficiency.
* Conduct in-depth analysis of trading strategies and execution performance.
* Implement statistical and quantitative models to support trading decisions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate new features and enhancements.
* Monitor and troubleshoot automated trading systems to ensure optimal operation.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in trading technology.



  





**Qualifications:** 




  




* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, with a demonstrated record of academic excellence.
* 1-3 years of professional experience in Python programming, with a focus on automation and system optimization.
* Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with a solid understanding of statistical models.
* Experience with algorithmic trading systems and financial markets is preferred but not required
* Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Arietis Health, we recognize the vital role healthcare revenue cycle plays in maintaining the well-being of individuals and businesses alike. Our commitment is to demystify healthcare billing by empowering individuals and collaborating with premier healthcare organizations to address their executives' most pressing revenue cycle challenges. By doing so, we enable them to shift their focus towards providing exceptional patient care. Grounded in the belief of harnessing the expertise of a highly skilled team and advanced technology, we strive to cultivate a seamless patient billing experience that not only excels in efficiency but also delivers superior results. Join us in achieving our mission. We're actively seeking a Durham, North Carolina-based **Data Analyst** to join our fast-growing team. If you're eager to contribute to redefining the landscape of healthcare revenue cycle management and be a part of our collaborative, positive, and human-centric culture, we'd love to hear from you!
**About the Position:** The **Data Analyst** position will be responsible for coordination of projects for new and existing clients, ensuring appropriate site set up and execution of strategic initiatives for growth and site management. This role requires cross-functional collaboration and tracking of projects with hospital IT executives, hospital administrators, internal IT stakeholders, and internal client services colleagues.
**What You’ll Do**: To excel in this role, an individual must satisfactorily perform the duties below; additional duties may be assigned. We are committed to intensive training opportunities and making reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Your contribution in this capacity is essential to our shared success.
* Serve as the intermediary between client services and IT to tackle critical special projects for clients and overall account management efforts.
* Weekly reporting requirements and document maintenance for clients.
* Document and track workflow requirements for clients and translate requirements with colleagues in other departments and applications.
* Quarterback EMR migrations and provisioning.
* Ensure appropriate IT and interface setup for clients (e.g., workflow automations and enablement of SFTP’s, HL7, and scanners).
* Monitor existing dataflows and apply fixes as needed (e.g., manage issues with any chart transmission roadblocks and develop prompt solutions).
* Assist (Health Information Management department) manager with schedule reconciliations, identifying issues, and finding solutions when charts are not being processed as expected.
* Coordinate with PHI (Protected Health Information) in terms of quality of information coming from hospitals and reconnecting with hospital partners when relevant data is missing from the interface.
* Adhere to the Code of Conduct and Corporate Compliance Program.

**What You’ll Bring:*** Bachelor's degree in healthcare administration, IT, management, or related field.
* 2 – 3 years' experience. Research and analyze data, draw conclusions, and resolve issues. Preferred (not required) experience in using medical billing software and electronic medical records.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Experience in working with reports, spreadsheets and Excel.
* Problem solving abilities.
* Excellent communication and customer relation skills.
* Ability to multi-task.
* Possess strong organizational skills.
* Understand HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability) guidelines.
* Strong Language Ability: Read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Write routine reports and correspondence. Speak effectively before groups of customers or employees.
* Strong Mathematical Ability: Calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
* Strong Reasoning Ability: Solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
	+ Excellent technical writing capability
	+ Excellent non-technical writing capability
	+ Excellent telephone skills and manner with customers
	+ Excellent face-to-face interactions with customers
	+ Excellent organizational skills
	+ Excellent process development and documentation skills

**What We Offer:**
A chance to simplify revenue cycle management, together at a high-growth company! Since our founding in 2020, we’re already helping millions of patients and thousands of providers each year. We are proud to offer:
* Competitive compensation
* 401K plan with company match
* PTO with 12 additional paid holidays
* Telehealth at no cost to employees
* Health, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage
* Group life insurance, Optional Life, Critical Illness and more.
* Training, development, and mentorship opportunities

**Other:**
* Our commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace is unwavering. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
* The job description provided above is not an exhaustive list of duties and standards for the position. Incumbents are encouraged to willingly embrace additional instructions and undertake related duties as assigned by their supervisor.
* As a condition of employment, you are expected to adhere to established compliance program requirements and uphold the employee and internet codes of conduct outlined in the Employee Handbook.
* While all tasks and responsibilities listed are considered essential functions of this position, we recognize that business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.
* The work environment characteristics outlined herein represent those encountered by an employee while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be arranged to facilitate individuals with disabilities in fulfilling these essential functions.
* The physical requirements outlined herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. We are dedicated to making reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to fulfill these essential functions.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Data Governance Business Analyst** 

$99,473 to $155,975 Annually

Job #15985

**We are recruiting for a range of titles; Placement will be based on qualifications.**

**First round resume review will take place on 08/22/24 and interviews will be scheduled for chosen qualified candidates. Resumes will continue to be accepted through 09/08/24 and additional interviews will be scheduled if needed.**

**Basic Responsibilities**

The Business Analyst II uses their analytic capabilities to improve and streamline processes that help the department/organization meet its objectives and reach goals. They help initiate greater employee productivity and they ultimately support business information systems that provide solutions to a variety of business issues across multiple departments. The Business Analyst II analyzes large amounts of data and other business processes to form ideas and fix problems. They must communicate their ideas in a clear and compelling manner. Thorough research must be conducted about new processes and software to present results that are effective. The Business Analyst II will support the development of training material, participate in the customer implementation, and provide post-implementation support. They coordinate with the business unit who performs testing, validating, evaluation of new applications and functions, and identifying issues that could impact the scope and work with the project manager to identify solutions.

**Minimum Qualifications**

**Business Analyst II: $99,473 – $124,342**

· Bachelor’s Degree in a Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field and two (2) years’ experience in system analytics or development.

**OR**

· Six (6) years of experience in system analytics or development.

**Business Analyst III: $124,779 – $155,975**

· Bachelor’s Degree in a Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field and four (4) years’ experience in system analytics or development.

**OR**

· Eight (8) years of experience in system analytics or development.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience in supporting data governance frameworks and/or data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
* Experience in developing and supporting solutions using AI and other technologies: Hands-on experience in designing and implementing automated solutions leveraging artificial intelligence technologies or other relevant tools to enhance business processes and drive efficiency.
* Strong technical skills in data analysis, and machine learning tools, combined with business acumen to translate technical insights into strategic decisions.
* Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Administration, or a related field.

**Benefits**

In addition to a competitive compensation program, Snohomish County PUD #1 offers a comprehensive benefits package. title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
**Position Summary**

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Jr. Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing reporting from NetSuite ERP, analyzing data to drive business decisions, and creating refreshable reports for business units. This role will lead monthly account reviews, address inconsistent data, and develop KPI and dashboard reports tailored to user needs.

**Job Description**

* Design and develop reports from NetSuite ERP to provide actionable insights.
* Create and maintain refreshable reports that allow business units to periodically update data from the system.
* Synthesize diverse datasets into a coherent framework, enabling uniform reporting methodologies across our portfolio brands.
* Create and refine executive management reports.
* Optimize the NetSuite implementation of business tools within NetSuite.
* Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
* Provide data-driven recommendations to support business decisions.
* Lead monthly account reviews to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* Investigate inconsistent data and develop action plans to address issues.
* Develop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and dashboard reports tailored to individual user needs.
* Continuously monitor and update KPIs and dashboards to reflect current business objectives.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in Business, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field
* Proven experience with BI tools and reporting, particularly with NetSuite ERP.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate seamlessly with stakeholders at all levels within the organization.
* Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to lead projects and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
* Ambitious self-starter, interested in both personal and professional growth and development within a fast-moving agile startup culture.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with SQL and data query languages.
* Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and best practices.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**HHS Behavioral Health/Technical Services** - Remote in the U.S. - **Data Analyst**

As a **Data Analyst,** you will be a part of Behavioral Health's Technical Services team. You will serve as the primary data analyst for the ND State Hospital, providing data analytics, modeling, and visualization to support clinical and business operations. You will serve as a technical resource working alongside quality management and informatics staff to respond to complex data requests and maintain data quality.

**To thrive in this position**, you must be a professional who can take raw healthcare data, build processes to draw insights and track metrics, and deliver analysis and reports that are easily understood by non-technical audiences. You should love to learn new things and be excited to apply your skills to solve problems.


You will develop and maintain data models using Power BI, SQL, and other available tools across a variety of data sources. You will also become an expert in the State Hospital's Electronic Healthcare Record data, with the ability to write complex queries and create dashboards that take a deep dive into answering hard questions. You will use your passion for data and technology to automate manual processes and provide transparency into the hospital's data.


You will be the technical professional that understands the hospital's data extracts for federal and accreditation reporting, including data mapping, reporting specifications, and the impact of system changes. Whether responding to internal or external requests, you will maintain an end-to-end understanding of where data sources from, how to extract it, and how to aggregate the metrics needed.

**To be considered for this position**, you must have a bachelor's degree and three years of experience in a data analysis role. Additional work experience as described may substitute for up to two years of the education requirement on a year-for-year basis. Preference will be given to candidates with knowledge of analytics tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, R, or similar technologies.

**About HHS**: ND HHS strives to make North Dakota the healthiest state in the nation by reinforcing the foundations of well-being: physical, economic, and behavioral. Those services are to be delivered as close to home as possible with a focus on dignity and respect. The keys to delivery of those services are the 2800 committed, compassionate ND HHS team members and more than $6 billion in funding from nearly 200 different federal, state, and special sources.


**Location**: ND HHS utilizes a blended workplace model. This position may work from home anywhere in North Dakota with the ability and willingness to work during regular business hours.


**About Team ND**

*"Far and away the best prize life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing." - Theodore Roosevelt*


More than 7,500 talented, hard-working people across sixty-three agencies have come together as Team North Dakota. At Team ND, we are driven to succeed through gratitude, humility, curiosity and courage. Our purpose is to empower people, improve lives, and inspire success. Join us in being legendary.

**Total Rewards:** The State of North Dakota is committed to providing team members with a strong and competitive rewards package that support you, your health and your family.


Considering a new position on Team ND? How does your current position stack up? Use our Total Rewards Calculator to estimate.


**Application Procedures**

Your resume should include information to demonstrate how you meet the minimum qualifications as posted. If the Department's Human Resource Division is unable to determine that you meet the minimum qualifications credit will not be given. All application material must be received on or before the closing date by 11:59 pm.


Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. The Department of Health & Human Services does not offer or provide sponsorships.


This employer participates in E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: https://www.hhs.nd.gov/careers/e-verify


A copy of your qualifying degrees transcript and any applicable certifications or licensures must be provided at the time of an interview.


For more information about the position or if you need an accommodation, please contact Matthew Best at mabest@nd.gov or at 701-328-7563.


Employing Unit: ND HHS - Behavioral Health Division


Telephone Number: 701-328-2310


TTY Number: ND Relay Service 1-800-366-6888 (text); 1-800-366-6889 (voice)


If you are experiencing technical difficulties with the Application Process or uploading attachments, please contact recruiter@nd.gov or (701)328-3290.


**Equal Employment Opportunity**

The State of North Dakota and this hiring agency do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation and gender identity), genetics, religion, age or disability in employment or the provisions of services and complies with the provisions of the North Dakota Human Rights Act.


As an employer, the State of North Dakota prohibits smoking in all places of state employment in accordance with N.D.C.C. Sect. 23-12-10.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Summary  

Act as liaison between business users and IT organization in support of applications and process improvements

**Essential Job Duties**

* Interpret and functionally design integration solutions between various systems.
* Assist in the acquisition and merger process to include data conversions and process re-engineering.
* Work directly with developers in troubleshooting application issues to find root cause analysis.
* Research current environment, analyze information, and provide sound solutions to complex business issues.
* Develop business requirements for resolving issues, new enhancements, and new applications.
* Continually analyze existing applications and business processes to identify opportunities for improvement.
* Provide support to business owners and users regarding business applications and processes.
* Work with business owners and users to create functional requirements.
* Document business processes.
* Act as a point of contact for business and technical support.
* Develop and maintain documentation for current applications and user manuals.
* Participate as a liaison between the business user community and the IT Organization.
* Contact point for systems and services that are outsourced to a third-party developer or maintenance organization.
* Other duties as assigned

**Skill/Requirements**

* Bachelors degree in Business, Information Systems or related field; or equivalent combination of education, experience and training that provides the required knowledge and skills
* Minimum 2 to 4 years of experience with enterprise systems in a role as a functional business analyst
* Report development using the Microsoft Business Intelligence tools
* Project Management Certification a plus.
* Interviewing skills, to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information.
* Listening skills, to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say.
* Analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.
* Facilitation skills, to lead requirements workshops.
* Observational skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas of opportunity.
* Writing skills, to communicate information effectively to customers.
* Organizational skills, to work with the vast array of information gathered and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information.
* Interpersonal skills, to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project stakeholders.
* MS Office, Project, & Visio skills required.

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
The IT Business Analyst assists the business with addressing challenges using technology in an ever-evolving cycle of continuous improvement, providing value in many forms. Using the ability to understand technology capabilities and business processes, this position will provide solutions through process improvement, solution design and technology implementation efforts throughout the business. This position will identify, collect, clarify, and translate business challenges, bringing clarity and proposing solutions which improve the whole. A focus area will be on finding areas to improve flow: Use of process automation, workflow automation, improving integrations, and working towards complementary solutions. We are looking for a self-starting, problem solver who is curious, detail-oriented, and organized, with a proactive, continuous-improvement mindset and the desire to learn and grow.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Build relationships with team members across the business through ongoing interactions.
* Collaborate within and across business units to understand and define business process improvements, deliver strategic value, build on common platforms, and maximize strategic business capabilities based on need.
* Initiate and deliver incremental, ongoing improvements to existing processes, integrations, and services.
* Assist with enterprise systems implementations and related organizational change management.
* Respond to business requests, assisting with analysis, justification, design, and implementation of solutions ranging from process improvements to software, systems, and integrations.
* Analyze initiatives and projects to estimate value, cost, and effort.
* Create and maintain business requirements documents, solution design documents, technical specifications, use cases, test cases and test plans where needed to accomplish objectives.
* Provide tier 2-3 production support of enterprise applications, engaging vendor support when necessary.

**Qualifications/Requirements**

* 2+ years of work experience in related disciplines such as process improvement, process optimization, process management, product management, solution design, application administration, business analysis, systems analysis.
* Degree, coursework, or experience in Business Analysis, Information Technology, or related area. CCBA, CBAP or related certifications desired.
* Familiar with API’s, UI/UX, database applications, web application architecture, and similar concepts.
* An understanding of enterprise database applications architecture and functional concepts, data integrations, and mobile applications would be helpful in this role.
* Familiarity with small-medium project planning, agile software development lifecycle.
* Good communication skills (oral, written and verbal).

*Cianbro is an employee-owned, tobacco-free, equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate based on marital status, race, color, creed, gender, sex, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, veteran status, union affiliation, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or other legally protected status.*

title: Business Analyst
description:
Position Information
**Position Title** Business Analyst
  

**Position Type** Admin/Professional
  

**Department** Information Technology
  

**Full or Part Time** Full Time
  

**Pay Grade** MN9
  

Position Summary Information
**Summary**
The Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.
  

**Principal Functional Responsibilities**
**Operational and Process Analysis:** Conducts and/or facilitates operational and process analyses; translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications.  

**Project Management:** Coordinates the development and execution of test plans. Assists with project management, including initial review and analysis of requests, project planning and scheduling.  

**Documentation:** Assists with creating documentation, procedures, presentations or training materials.  

**Software Evaluation:** Assists in the evaluation of new software and new features and recommends appropriate strategies for their adoption.  

**Training:** Facilitate training and provide support to business users on new systems or processes.  

**Testing:** Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure the functionality of system solutions.
  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, business, communications, or equivalent OR equivalent work experience as a Business Analyst.
* Experience with creating documentation, training materials, requirements and testing plans; process analysis and project management; working with an integrated administrative computer system.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Student Information System (SIS) applications, preferably Banner.


  

**Physical Requirements**
Must be able to utilize a phone, computer and other office equipment.
  

**Department Specific Information**

title: Technical Business Analyst
description:
**TeamHealth is named among the Top 150 Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker's Hospital Review. Newsweek Magazine recognizes TeamHealth ‘as one of the greatest workplaces for diversity, 2024’** and TeamHealth is also ranked as ‘The World’s Most Admired Companies’ by Fortune Magazine. TeamHealth, an established healthcare organization is physician-led and patient focused. We continue to grow across the U.S. from our Clinicians to Corporate Employees. Join us.


**This is a remote position anywhere in the United States.**


**OVERVIEW:**


**The Technical Business Analyst** serves as a liaison between business partners, the technical delivery team, and other EIT resources to establish alignment on requirements, prioritization, delivery timelines, and efficient technical delivery processes. The Analyst must be able to effectively operate and appropriately communicate in both business and technical contexts. The scope of work supports the full lifecycle for solutions, including concept definition, business and technical design, development, organizational change, and ongoing support.


**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**


* Serve as a liaison between business and technical resources, effectively bridging technical and business languages, viewpoints, and capabilities to create a clear, shared understanding of process and solution requirements
* Identify detailed requirements from business partners through interviews, documentation, facilitated working sessions, and end user observation.
* Work with business partners to document technical requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria
* Work with business partners to fully understand root causes of issues in order to identify and effectively address underlying problems to drive better technical solutions
* Work with software engineering team to refine and manage requirements documentation for backlog items, features, and epics (Azure Dev Ops/ADO)
* Serve as a technical product ownerfor software development and implementation
* Assist Agile and Scrum teams to optimize their effectiveness in delivery, and align the activities of multiple teams to accelerate value creation.
* Create, maintain, and prioritize team product backlogs to ensure the development teams are working on the most valuable features and improvements
* Assist the software engineering team in maturing their story point estimation, velocity prediction, and other metrics to establish more accurate expectations with business partners
* Actively participate in Scrum ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives
* Help business partners align their needs with overall company goals and objectives by encouraging the prioritization of work according to strategic direction and value proposition
* Collaborate with Solution Delivery and Technical Delivery Leadership on overall EIT priorites and work allocation for the teams
* Maintain an understandingof EIT capabilities in order to deliver the best solutions to business problems
* Work directly with others to navigate project roadblocks and mediate between EIT and business partner priorities
* Responsible for maintaining and updating skills by participating in educational opportunities consistent with the technologies and methodologies established at TeamHealth
* Responsible for completion of all documentation processes and project and time tracking efforts in a timely manner


**Job Requirements:**


**JOB QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems, computer science, healthcare or related field
* Experience in enterprise healthcare process analysis, applications and solutions is a plus, but not required
* Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies required
* Strong interpersonal communication skills required, including the ability to work diplomatically with a diverse workforce
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Experience in coordinating simultaneous assignments by assessing project deadlines, establishing work priorities, and coordinating personal work schedules
* Resourcefulness, ingenuity, and creative problem solving.
* Ability to work independently
* Strong organizational and analytical skills accompanied by flexibility to quickly adapt to a changing business environment

description:
### **General information**

### **Ally and Your Career**

Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams, and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too? **Work Schedule:** Ally designates roles as (1) fully on-site, (2) hybrid, or (3) fully remote. Hybrid roles are generally expected to be in the office a certain number of days per week as indicated by your manager. Your hiring manager will discuss this role's specific work requirements with you during the hiring process. All work requirements are subject to change at any time based on leader discretion and/or business need.
### **The Opportunity**

As part of the Data Solutions Support team, this Senior Analyst will be responsible to leverage Snowflake, AWS and Cloudera Hadoop systems to build best-in-class Data Management and Analytical pipelines for Ally's Auto Asset Management team. The Senior Analyst at Ally will utilize analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.


### **The Work Itself**

* + Responsible to play as Data Analyst role to help build a centralized data warehouse using Ally's Enterprise Data & Analytics standards.
	+ Responsible to come up with Curated data layers that each line of business will be utilizing for analytics and for Business Intelligence purpose.
	+ Develop and maintain data pipelines and work closely with data engineering team to migrate to production Oracle, Big Data platforms: Cloud databases eg: Snowflake/Red Shift based on business need.
	+ Possess Data Warehousing principals and architecture patterns to help build reporting data marts in Oracle, Big Data platforms: Hadoop and Cloud data bases eg: Snowflake/Red Shift
	+ Experience and working knowledge in extracting data from traditional data warehouse, big data ecosystems and cloud data warehouses to produce critical data for business analyst executives and operational leaderships.
	+ Partner with the business to consult and translate the business needs to design and develop tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights/data visualization.
	+ Able to work in Agile team and help formulate technical stories for the data engineering team and help prioritize them based on business-critical data needs.
	+ Advanced working knowledge of SQL, Databases and working knowledge of SAS/Python/DBT with the ability to write complex SQL statements to build data tables and produce reports
	+ Stays current with industry trends and leads development of key data/analytics innovation platforms
	+ Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner
	+ Ensure stability, performance and support of production reporting and meet demand for data across Analytic teams
	+ Able to run multiple projects in parallel and should be communicating on status and risks timely.
### **The Skills You Bring**

* + Bachelor’s degree preferred, Masters is a plus (**field of study**: Computer Science, Data Management, Data Science, Management Information System, Business Analytics)
	+ At least 3 years of experience data analysis and data management
	+ At least 3 years of programming experience in ANSI SQL, SAS, working knowledge of Python, and data warehouse platforms along with experience in Snowflake.
	+ RDBMS – Oracle, Snowflake, SQL server.
	+ Programming Languages - SQL(Advanced), Python (Preferred), DBT (Preferred), SAS (Nice to have)
	+ Data platforms - AWS, Snowflake (Advanced), Oracle
	+ Data governance/risk management – Alation, Manta, Collibra Data Quality, Observability etc.,
### **How We'll Have Your Back**

Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. Our Total Rewards program includes industry-leading compensation and benefits plus additional incentives that are designed to meet your needs and those of your family so you can get the most out of your career and your life, including:* **Time Away:** 11 paid holidays, 20 paid time off days, and 8 hours of volunteer time off, yearly (paid time off is prorated based on start date)
* **Planning for the Future:** plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributions, student loan pay downs and 529 educational save up assistance programs, tuition reimbursement, employee stock purchase plan, and financial learning center and financial coach access.
* **Supporting your Health & Well-being:** flexible health and insurance options including medical, dental and vision, employee, spouse and child life insurance, short- and long-term disability, pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions, Healthcare FSA, critical illness, accident & hospital indemnity insurance, and a total well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally, and financially.
* **Building a Family:** adoption, surrogacy and fertility assistance as well as paid parental and caregiver leave, Dependent Day Care FSA back-up child and adult/elder care days and childcare discounts.
* **Work-Life Integration:** other benefits including Mentally Fit Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs.
* **Other compensations:** depending on the role for which you are considered, you may be eligible for travel allowances, relocation assistance, a signing bonus and/or equity.
* To view more detailed information about Ally’s Total Rewards, please visit this link: https://www.ally.com/content/dam/pdf/corporate/ally-total-rewards-snapshot.pdf

 **Who We Are:**

  

Ally Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com.

  

Ally is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.

  

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical or mental disabilities. For accommodation requests, email us at work@ally.com. Ally will not discriminate against any qualified individual who is capable of performing the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.


**Base Pay Range**: $55000 - $95000 USD
An individual's position in the range is determined by the specific role, the scope and responsibilities of the role, work experience, education, certification(s), training, and additional qualifications. We review internal pay, the competitive market, and business environment prior to extending an offer.
Incentive Compensation: This position is eligible to participate in our annual incentive plan.

title: Data Analyst
description:

**Job Summary:** We are seeking a full-time Bilingual Data Analyst with technical data skills to pull and interpret qualitative and quantitative data from complex applications. The analyst will process and analyze datasets, provide insights, and develop recommendations to guide product growth and improve the implementation of interactive tools and features.

**Responsibilities:**

* Process and analyze various types of datasets, developing recommendations in plain language based on that analysis.
* Measure behavior changes throughout the product development cycle.
* Collect data around the implementation of interactive tools and features, elevating successes and highlighting problems.
* Create easy-to-understand data visualizations and prepare slides and written reports to share findings.
* Identify success metrics and track progress.
* Provide insights to help guide product growth.
* Present and explain data during meetings.
* Communicate frequently with teammates about the progress of projects.
* Work as a member of diverse teams towards a common goal.

**Requirements:**

* Experience processing and analyzing various types of datasets and developing recommendations based on that analysis.
* Experience measuring behavior changes throughout the product development cycle.
* Experience collecting data around the implementation of interactive tools and features.
* Experience creating data visualizations and preparing slides and written reports.
* Experience identifying success metrics and tracking progress.
* Ability to provide insights to help guide product growth.

	+ Google Search Console
	+ Google BigQuery

	+ Google Sheets
	+ Microsoft Excel

title: Data Analyst
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to work in collaboration with our Quality and Compliance team to develop and maintain reports, perform data analysis, and provide electronic health record (EHR) Service Desk support.
Responsibilities:
**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES*** Develops reports using Crystal and SQL for the electronic health record.
* Develops widgets using SQL and HTML for the electronic health record.
* Extracts and analyzes data from the electronic health record system.
* Maintains documentation of standard work.
* Provides ServiceDesk support for end users issues.

**SUPPLEMENTAL FUNCTIONS**
Works collaboratively with the Business Applications team and Project Leads to provide technical assistance and data analysis as required.  

Performs other duties as assigned.**KEY WORK RELATIONSHIPS**
Daily collaboration with other team members to provide technical assistance and data analysis. Requires strong compatibility and exemplary trustworthiness in frequent interaction with Sound management and team members.
Qualifications:
**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE*** Minimum of two years of experience with increasing responsibilities in Report creation, data analysis
* Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.
* Strong and diverse knowledge base and proven experience in multiple areas of Information Technology.
* Customer service experience required.
* Experience in a health care setting is desirable, but not required.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES*** Knowledge in report creation, Tableau, Crystal reports, and SQL data queries.
* Ability to analyze and resolve complex issues, both logical and interpersonal.
* Effective verbal and written communications skills.
* Strong customer service skills are important.
* Ability to work evenings and/or weekends as needed.
* Self-motivation - ability to work with minimal supervision; independent, cooperative.
* In-depth knowledge and experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Management tools.
* Strong knowledge of data and security concepts as they apply to HIPAA.

 **PHYSICAL DEMANDS**  

To successfully perform the essential duties of this position, an individual must be able to sit at a desk for four or more hours a day, and use office equipment, including phones and computer keyboards, for four or more hours per day. Individuals must be able to engage team members over the phone and in-person by voice. Regular attendance is an essential function of the position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to assist individuals with disabilities to perform essential position functions.  


Perks at Sound!:
**All Team Members at Sound working 40 hours per week will be eligible for the following benefits:*** 100% Paid Medical & Dental Insurance
	+ Full time Team Member and child(ren) coverage until child's 26th birthday
	+ Spouse/Domestic Partner coverage available (team member pays full cost)
* Paid Life Insurance  

	+ 2x annual salary + additional $25,000
* Long Term Disability Insurance (60% monthly salary)  

	+ 100% premiums paid by Sound
* 18 Days of Paid Rest and Relaxation (Vacation) - beginning first year
* 12 Days of Paid Sick Leave
* 9 Days of Paid Holidays
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)  

	+ for health care (limited) and dependent day care costs (pre-tax)
* Employee Assistance Plan (EAP)  

	+ The Standard
* Sound retirement plan:  

	+ 401(k) plan (organization contribution) – Sound contributes 3% to team members plan even if you don’t.
	+ Team members are 100% vested; team members may contribute to their own plan
* Paid Training  

	+ Free in-house professional training and $400 annually + 3 paid days off-site training
* Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)

title: Financial Data Analyst
description:
The Finance Data & Analytics team is growing to support the increasing demand for data and analytical reporting. Reporting to the Technology & Data Analytics Manager, the Finance Data Analyst will serve as an extension of the team while collaborating with teams and individuals across the department to gather requirements and build out solutions to further enhance the department’s data and analytics capabilities.


Our team utilizes our skills to not only solve business problems that have already been identified, but also proactively address opportunities for improvement and create innovative solutions across the department. We look for highly motivated individuals who are proactive, eager to learn, and ready to contribute both as an individual and as a part of a team. Having a passion for data and helping others understand the ways in which we can leverage data to solve business problems is a crucial component of this role.

  

  

The team thrives on an ability to collaboratively build and deliver solutions for the Finance Department in an environment that fosters continuous improvement and learning. This role is a unique opportunity to help Finance in their journey to use data in the most effective manner possible while driving innovation and efficiency. We invite you to check our freshly launched Finance Landing Page to learn more about our Associates and teams!

**As a Finance Data Analyst, your responsibilities will include:**General Duties

* Challenge yourself to learn new skills and evolve as technology advances
* Utilize creative thinking and innovative skills to help identify and address critical business problems and opportunities
* Establish yourself as a trusted resource to all teams within Finance
* Provide guidance and mentorship to a Finance Data Analytics Intern
* Build strong, trust-based relationships with our partners on the IT Data Team and within business units


Data and Analytics


* Gather and document requirements for dashboards, reports, and potential process automations
* Meet with department leaders to discuss existing processes and identify improvement, enhancement, and automation opportunities
* Build reports, dashboards, processes, etc. as defined by requirements
* Use tools such as Alteryx, Power BI, Power Automate, Microsoft Excel, SSRS and others to develop solutions which increase Finance’s ability to provide meaningful data back to our business partners
* Build and execute test plans to validate accuracy of all new development, enhancements, and updates
* Serve as a steward of the data that is used by Finance to ensure accuracy and completeness
* Partner with the Technology and Data Analytics Manager on reviewing the Finance specific elements targeted for use in our data hub to ensure alignment to departmental needs
* Maintain and support all items under the purview of the Finance Data Analytics team to ensure immediate and long-term success of the items built by the Finance Data Analytics team
* Develop training materials to be utilized by associates to help empower a self-service model
* Conduct training sessions for Finance Associates as needed
* Other tasks as assigned by the Technology & Data Analytics Manager

**What we need from you:*** Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Data Science, Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, or related fields
* 0-3 years of Financial Industry experience
* Experience with data analysis, data profiling, data modeling, SQL knowledge is helpful, but not a requirement
* Familiarity with tools such as Alteryx, Power BI, SQL Server Management Studio, Microsoft Excel, etc.
* Have a passion for data, an appetite for continuous learning, and possess a natural curiosity in understanding how data and technology can be used to solve business problems
* Ability to manage a backlog of work items and prioritize appropriately while working individually or as a team
* Detail oriented and exhibits organizational, time management, and critical thinking skills


#LI-YA1

Baird is committed to inclusion & diversity for our clients, our associates and the communities where we live and work. This commitment stems from our culture of integrity, genuine concern for others and respect for the individual. We view inclusion & diversity as an ongoing journey – one of shared responsibility, continuous improvement and a focus on progress. title: IT Data Analyst (Hybrid)
description:
We are excited to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces by Fortune Magazine! We are proud to offer you 12 paid holidays annually. For an overview of our benefits and time off, please follow this link to learn more:US Stryker employee benefits.
As an IT Data Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to define, develop, and manage data products that contribute to our Data & Analytics organization's success. You will play a supporting role in our data-driven decision-making processes and contribute to the development and management of data products.


\*\*This position is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days per week on-site at our Allendale, NJ office.\*\*

 **Who We** **Want****:**

* **Curious learners**. People who seek out cutting-edge research and information to expand and enhance their ability to develop new ideas into reality.
* **Data translators**. Highly effective communicators who can transform data findings into recommendations to compose reports and executive level presentations.
* **Self-directed imitators**. People who take ownership of their work and need no prompting to drive productivity, change, and outcomes.
* **Strategic thinkers**. People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, or sales opportunities.

**What You Will Do:**

**Data Product Ownership:**

* Take ownership of assigned data products, including their development, maintenance, and optimization.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define product requirements and specifications.
* Ensure data products align with business goals and contribute to overall organizational success.

**Data Analysis and Insights:**

* Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover insights and trends within large datasets.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide data-driven solutions.

**Data Engineering:**

* Assist in the design and maintenance of data pipelines to ensure seamless data flow.
* Support data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
**Collaboration and Communication:**

* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders.
* Communicate complex technical concepts and findings to non-technical audiences.
* Participate in regular team meetings and contribute to a collaborative and innovative team culture.
**What You Will Need:**

* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university required.
* Bachelor’s or Master's degree in the areas of Computer science, Engineering, Information Systems, Business, or equivalent field of study is preferred.
* Ability to analyze business situations required.
* Understanding of database concepts and experience with SQL preferred.
* Experience with data engineering and product management or advanced data science technologies preferred.

Health benefits include: Medical and prescription drug insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, critical illness insurance, accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, personalized healthcare support, wellbeing program and tobacco cessation program. Financial benefits include: Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance. Stryker offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually. Depending on customer requirements employees and new hires in sales and field roles that require access to customer accounts as a function of the job may be required to obtain various vaccinations as an essential function of their role.

title: EHS Data Analyst
description:
**Update: Manager is open to seeing fully remote candidates as long as they are able to align with PST working hours.** 

**Ideal Candidate: 2-4 years of experience, program management experiences are helpful, strong excel, data analysis, basic coding, environmental and sustainability exposure. Strong communication skills is a must have.**

client is a leading biotechnology company committed to providing life-saving medicines to our patients. We also acknowledge the importance of protecting our planet and improving environmental health. As a pioneer in our field, and a science-based company, we are dedicated to driving sustainable practices and reducing our carbon footprint. We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Sustainability Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to our ongoing efforts in achieving 2027 Environmental Sustainability Goals.

This is a temporary position in client’s global environmental sustainability team, housed in Engineering. The data analyst will work with client’s carbon accounting and decarbonization lead. The role will support the expansion of data management and analysis capabilities to track key performance indicators.

Responsibilities include:

* This position will require collecting internal and third-party information related to carbon footprints to track Scope 3 carbon reductions across our enterprise.
* Assess supplier data to develop a relative ranking / categorization program.
* Collect, analyze, and interpret sustainability data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
* Analyze structured and unstructured datasets, and ability to data gap fill when information is not available.
* Evaluate case studies with our carbon accounting leader to assess carbon reductions in our supply chain to help develop our longer term (net zero) strategy.
* Improve recordkeeping and data management from internal teams located in various business units across the enterprise (matrix organization).
* Demonstrate collaboration, problem solving, and conflict management skills to ensure a productive work environment and achievement of objectives.
* Analytical, organizational, and project management experience and ability to work independently, including the ability to multi-task and manage demands and/or projects simultaneously.
* Prepare reports, presentations, and visualizations to effectively communicate sustainability metrics and progress to stakeholders.
* Stay up to date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices in sustainability data management and analysis.

Requirements:

* 1-4 years of demonstrated project management experience in industry.
* Bachelor’s degree in environmental science, engineering, data science, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
* Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the field of sustainability or environmental science.
* Proficiency in data management and analysis tools, such as Excel and statistical software.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and identify trends and patterns.
* Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data collection and analysis.
* Ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
* Knowledge of key sustainability initiatives such as the Greenhouse Gas Protocol, Science Based Targets, life cycle analysis, product carbon footprint, as well as greenhouse gas inventories and databases.
* Data analysis skills and proficiency in excel, R, SAP, Enablon, Tableau, and/or Python.
* Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $36.62 - $40.70 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Environmental data analysis: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Data Analyst**

**Who we are:**


At Lifepoint Health, we provide quality healthcare to rural communities. As a valued member of our team, you will be an integral part of a group working together to elevate Lifepoint's healthcare delivery network. Our network includes 60+ community hospitals, 60+ rehabilitation/behavioral health hospitals, and 250 additional sites of care across the United States. As an organization, we are dedicated to serving communities nationwide by providing exceptional care. We believe in the power of our talented teams and strive to create environments where employees find purpose and fulfillment.

 **What you’ll do:**


As a **Data Analyst**, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help drive strategic decisions and improve business processes. This is an entry-level position ideal for candidates looking to start their career in data analysis.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collect and analyze data from various sources.
* Assist in the development and maintenance of databases and data systems.
* Identify trends and patterns in data and provide insights to support business decisions
* Generate reports and provide insights to support business decisions.
* Collaborate with other departments to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
* Ensure data integrity and accuracy.
* Create and maintain documentation for data processes and reports.

 **What you’ll need:**

Education:

* Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.


Experience:

* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R).**Why choose us:**


As a team member of the Health Support Center, our goal is to support those that are in our facilities who are interfacing and providing care to our patients and community members. Our focus is to attract, retain, and empower a diverse and determined workforce. Our mission statement is at the heart of who we are and what we do: “Making Communities Healthier.” In this shared mission, we believe that our collective efforts will shape a healthier future for the communities we serve.

**Benefits:** We offer an excellent total compensation package, including a competitive salary and benefits. Some of our benefits include 401k, flexible PTO, generous Employee illness benefit (EIB), medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, and an Employee Assistance Program. We believe that happy, healthy people have a passionate engagement with life and work and have designed our package to enhance your wellbeing.
